title: 109_hr4748
content: The Act may be cited as the "Louisiana Emergency Needs Corps of Engineers Authorization Act of 2006". It pertains to hurricane and flood protection in Lake Pontchartrain, Louisiana. The Secretary of the Army must submit a report to the Senate and House committees within 20 days of the Act's enactment. The report will outline activities to reconstruct hurricane and flood protection measures for Lake Pontchartrain in Louisiana. The Secretary of the Army must submit a report outlining activities to reconstruct and fortify floodwalls, construct pumping stations, install gate-like structures, and prevent seepage and undermining in coastal areas of Louisiana affected by Hurricane Katrina or Rita. The President declared Hurricane Katrina or Rita to exist after August 29, 2005, in accordance with the Stafford Disaster Relief Act. Activities were identified to strengthen hurricane protection and flood control infrastructure to prevent failure under hurricane conditions. The Secretary may implement activities identified in a report to strengthen hurricane protection and flood control infrastructure, with a 100 percent Federal share of the cost. Appropriations are authorized for fiscal years 2006 through 2010. Appropriations totaling $2,188,000,000 are allocated to the Secretary for fiscal years 2006 through 2010. $1,400,000,000 is designated for activities in subsections (1) through (3) of subsection (a), and $788,000,000 is allocated for activities in subsection (a)(4). SEC. 3. COMPENSATION. The Secretary shall compensate property owners for improvements related to Hurricane Katrina or Rita without considering damage caused by the hurricanes. Compensation may be reduced by other payments received for hurricane-related damages. SEC. 4. EFFECT OF ACT. This Act does not impact the Secretary's authority under other Federal laws.
